ResourceHeader.ResourceName: IMP8 field and plasma data propagated to (17,0,0) Re
ResourceHeader.Description: This is a family of data sets containing 1-min resolution IMP 8 magnetic field and plasma parameters, in GSE and GSM coordinates, propagated from the location of the IMP 8 spacecraft to the location (17,0,0) Re, GSE. Propagation was done by J. Weygand at UCLA/IGPP using software provided by D. Weimer. The software determines normal directions to assumed planar phase fronts using a modified minimum variance analysis of 1-min magnetic field data, and propagates data using these normals and the IMP8-observed solar wind flow velocity. Magnetic field data consist of three Cartesian components, while plasma data consist of three Cartesian components of the flow velocity vector plus proton density and temperature. Different subdirectories hold data for unique combinations of field vs. plasma parameters and GSE vs. GSM coordinates. See the VMO interface for a more detailed breakout.
ResourceHeader.Acknowledgement: Please acknowledge A. Szabo, IMP8/MAG PI, A.J. Lazarus, IMP8 Plasma PI, and J.M. Weygand.

AccessURL.Name: Weygand propagated data at UCLA
AccessURL.Description: High level directory with many dataset-specific subdirectories
